title: Special secret information about the new Champion Ornn
body:
Each region (NA/EUW/ect) have its own **slightly different** trailer (depending of the language)
https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/293500383769133056/343466050068807680/image.png

But each region brings new information
https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/293500383769133056/343466513799446548/image.png

And the french version tell us this :
https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/317365594259324929/343458517878964226/image.png

**He likes to eat spicy cherries**

*(I came all the way from EUW and a theory discord channel to bring you this secret information)*

replies.body: The Spiced Cherries FTW.

I have got to know though...which language is the teaser poem sung in? 
Because I am getting huge Scandianavian vibes off of it (Danish/Norwegian or thereabout).
It's in Ancient Freljordian :)
I'm Swedish, and personally I found it sounding similar to like, ol' native Scandinavians that live in Sweden, the Sames. It sounded awfully familiar to their language, although I'm not sure at all.

As a Norwegian, I recognized some of the words (which had a northern dialect of some sort), but as others were hidden in the voice pitch, I couldn't manage to make them out as a coherent sentence.

None of the Sami language is known to me, but I wouldn't rule that out.

>..."you'll soon find Ornn"

"...skal du finne Ornn"

Was what I made out.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e47AEBnu9SQ https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/293500383769133056/343466050068807680/image.png

And another word; "blive". I can feel my brain scrambling to find the language that contains that word... Considering the context, I suspect it's the translated "shall soon".

And the last part of the first verse:
"And you'll know, you're nearing Ornn" 
"Og du vet, du nærmer Ornn"

The above doesn't really make sense (I suspect poetic liberties on the grammar has been taken), because "du nærmer Ornn" literally translates as "you nearing Ornn". Skipping the "you _are_ nearing".

Not that I care about the grammar, I just really, really, REALLY want to know the "behind the scenes" on the language(s) used!

My bet is on the Norse language. Similar words (synonyms) to what we use in the current every-day "modern" language, but the words themselves are rather ancient.

Well we can draw the conclusion that it must be related to a germanic language with north influences. In Swedish, Blive is very similar to "bli, or "bliva" which can mean different thinks in different contexts. E.I. To be, or like you said "shall soon". Hm.. this is hard one to crack

It reminds me of when a native english speakers tries to speak swedish for the first  time lol, I'm write down what  I hear:

Ok so after listening to it, she seems to be singing the lyrics. As a swede I'd think it was some sort of norwigean with an accent

We're definitely in the right area:
Vocalist: Christine Hals
Norwegian-Swedish film composer [...]

http://www.imdb.com/name/nm4620230/

>Blive is very similar to "bli, or "bliva", which can mean different thinks in different contexts.

"Blive" is not just very similar to those words - it IS the same, but the Norwegian version.
And "blive" also means those same different things depending on context.

Until we get anything official, I'm settled on Norse/old Norwegian.

Even with my poor swedish skills I could make out quite a few words. Too bad they didn't include any finnish words or sounds. I mean I get that finnish is completely different, but it would be nice to see the finnish language get some love (ty riot for the Poros).

They made my toilet explode.

Worth.

I still wonder what kind of typical food Urtistan had

https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/293500383769133056/343557259860901888/ds1uVh9J2DN3Y2EqaZplQj09MkNq5VkQHNn8uo_mvr8.png

LAS, idk if LAN:

Top left:  "If you had seen the metal is (...) This material, as it was expensive (...) But I(he?) would give you only (?) (...) The third sister (...) The Bridge."

Top Right: "Forge (...) according to (...) Build (?)" 

Bottom left: "Meanwhile (...) A shovel so (?) (...) In the darkness. 

Then he turned east, where he threw his (...) It landed in the Great Sea. Some say that (...) Powerful trident at the bottom of the sea, and still uses it to reign/rule (? it seem like it says 'Gobernar')."

Bottom right: "Or his(?) Lost his (...) In the darkness (...)." Then the same as bottom left repeats.
Duuuuuude im so overhyped :D someone has to connect them alltogether :D

> [{quoted}](name=AngelOfPorn265,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=gPIQe0mQ,comment-id=00090000,timestamp=2017-08-06T00:17:05.833+0000)
>
> Duuuuuude im so overhyped :D someone has to connect them alltogether :D

I believe in you.

Apparently someone is still rulling his kingdom under sea with a trident forged by Ornn (with some star mineral?)

And for some obscure reasons he is also looking for **some pillars** and gave an item (fireproof?) to each of the Freljord sisters

Anyway, i love these kinds of "mini-lore events" to spend time before the release

Thank you lore team ;)

{{sticker:slayer-jinx-catface}}
i dont think its a trident what if its nami's tide caller staff
I think its Fizz's trident, in Fizz's lore it says he takes an enchanted trident from an old ruin.
I read somewhere it was a trident :v

I hope it's not Fizz trident, that would make me salty af >.>
Anyway a smith who can smelth star minerals could be of a lot of help for {{champion:136}} crown-removing :P
Or perhaps he made the crown?

Shit, I missed a few lines my bad.

Top left:

"If you had seen the metal is (...) This material, as it was expensive (...) But I(he?) would give you only (?) (...) The third sister (...) The Bridge.

*With that tool (...) bad (or evil?) through the (...) Ornn who (...)."

And dialogue? there are quotation marks as if someone was either speaking or quoting something.

EUW, Italian:

Top left: 
>I've never seen the god [...] nor she's ever seen [...]
>His/Her legends [...] And before that [...] The faces [...]
>The fire [...] around [...] We must [...]

Top right: 
>[...] black.
>[...] primordial [...]
>the Seal (1)

Bottom left:
>But this didn't stop the Three Sisters [...] nights to ask him. "There are creatures [...] that attack our tribes" said the Fist Sister.

Bottom right:
>He gifted him [...]
>True agent of change.
>He looked at the landscape, generated by his fight [...] go. After this, Ornn dedicated himself to craft tools and artifacts (2)

-------------------

Translator's notes:

(1)  the animal.
Common names in Italian aren't written with capital letters, so it's quite odd.

(2) I'm not quite sure about the last word being "artifact", because it's half-covered by the image of the page.
It kinda sounds like as though Ornn may have been the creator of the True Ice weapons that the sisters use.
Man I'm hoping for some sweet watcher lore now
This secret shall be kept with Illaoi's mangos and Braums goat milk products.

It says :
It was Anivias Fault...Even if...
Why Anivia never told him the..(truth?)....because i told that
i like my job>> Said Ornn,....Dmg

where (...) its covered

And on the other page at the end it says 

When he (Orn) was exhausted he (wished?) And the Earth answered to him opening up a flaming....throwing her heart.

I was aware of many translations, but not at all about the implications of Anivia
:O

It seems the talk about Anivia is only in the Greek one..

Riot trolls us,by giving to greeks (myself included) more info,cause they know we are so lazy we will not translate it :D

Good Morning Faux :) 

Here is my reply to Bioluminescence in another post.

He did help somehow the 3 sisters of Freljord but in the End he understood his wrongs and choose to go against them,he has a connection with Anivia,i think Anivia did not trust him,or turned her back on him,and he is the one that made the Trident of Nami,and nami is now officialy the ruler of the underwater Mer-rmaid Kingdom :) (Or Fizz as someone said in this post,but i think it says She rules not so sure) 

Also he did kill a lady/woman/girl,or the three sisters or Anivia killed someone important to him so he turned his back to them,and threw her heart into the volcanoe (i think). 

Added some changes.(And this is only from the texts in Russian/German/English/Greek).I got really confused with all the other translations.

Russian also kinda continues
> After the Job was done Orn left the (three?)

After the Job was done Orn left the three <...> he already said too much

Edit: whoops, English version have it too :)
Spasimpa krasava ,i could not see clearly,my vision is bad :) but you are completely right

Honestly, upon futher investigations about all information we have, it seems like we have almost identical information. Riot just gave full texts to translators to each region. And translators translated the full texts, and then Riot just took the bottom part of it. Thats why it seems like it's different information, it just was translated differently and the order of words is non-consistent in languages.

Cause all regions have this information about trident in the Great Sea, and about Ornn talking to three (sisters I suppose) and telling them too much.

Indeed...a wise edit xD 

It does but it also say after he (Orn) was finished with the TER?

Didn't Lissandra say (in her speech after ARAM) that the howling abyss had been there before her and the watchers?
The abyss was there, yeah, but not the bridge from what I remember.  I'll re-listen to it tonight.
